conclusion: Analyze the pressure-volume diagram and use thermodynamics to find temperature at state C.
Pressure-volume diagram: A to B is vertical, B to C is horizontal.
Process from A to C involves two steps: vertical A to B, horizontal B to C.
Work done from A to B is 0.5p_0V_0.
Work done from B to C is 0.
Total work done from A to C is 0.5p_0V_0.
First law of thermodynamics: Q = ΔU.
Change in internal energy ΔU = a(T_C - T_A).
Process is adiabatic, so Q = 0 and ΔU = 0.
Temperature at state C is T_0.
